lead_paragraph: The disciplinary action, which limits the church’s participation in Anglican Communion affairs, is a serious setback for the church and other Anglican provinces that support gay rights.

byline.contributor: Laurie Goodstein reported from New York and Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura from London.
byline.original: By LAURIE GOODSTEIN and KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA

snippet: The disciplinary action, which limits the church’s participation in Anglican Communion affairs, is a serious setback for the church and other Anglican provinces that support gay rights.

headline.main: Anglican Church Disciplines U.S. Episcopals Over Gay Marriages

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships

abstract: Archbishops of Anglican Communion vote to issue sanctions for three years on Episcopal Church, American branch of Communion, for 2015 decision to permit clergy to perform same-sex marriages.
